documents: Proposal for the International Neuroinformatics Coordinating Facility, GSoC 2025 Harmony Hub: Using Generative AI for Adaptive learning in Music By Alberto Acquilino, Mirko dAndrea and Keerthi Reddy Kambham Table of Contents Table of Contents 2 About me 3 Why did I decide to work for INCF? 3 Harmony

de to work for INCF? 3 HarmonyHub: Using Generative AI for Adaptive Learning in Music 4 Abstract 4 How do I plan to achieve: Milestone s 5 Plan of Action: Timeline 9 Open Source contributions and Projects 11 Expectations from Mentor 13 What are my other commitments? 14 What do I plan after the GSoC

What do I plan after the GSoC period is over? 14 Who am I: About me 15 The experience I possess: Places worked 16 About me Name: VISHAL KUMAR GEED Timezone: Indian Standard Time Email: vishalkumargeedgmail.com Course: B.E. - CSE University: CHANDIGARH UNIVERSITY Country: INDIA GSoC Full Time: Yes Po

: INDIA GSoC Full Time: Yes Portfolio: vishalkumargeed.in Resume: https:drive.google.comfiled1jgZ0QqCYBXvqDzcbp9L5INi5T8w0B3o2v iew?uspsharing Why did I decide to work for INCF? I wished to be at INCF because I strongly relate to its mission to advance open science and promote creative collaboration

promote creative collaboration in neuroinformatics. A collegiate student with a passion for technology and science, I see INCF as a special crossing point where new tools meet urgent real-life issues, particularly those of neuroscience. Working with leading minds and contributing to meaningful proje

ntributing to meaningful projects is very inspiring. What really piqued my interest was reading about a project at INCF utilizing generative AI for recommending and utilizing music. Not just does it demonstrate the potential of harnessing advanced technology to enhance creative as well as educationa

creative as well as educational experiences, it mirrors my personal fascination with AI. My recent work on projects utilizing the use of Gemini's Flash 2.0 model for creating smart contracts as well as one -click deployment further confirmed my interest in utilizing leading -edge AI methods to addre

ding -edge AI methods to address real issues. These projects gave me hands -on exposure to leading -edge technologies as well as made it apparent to me that INCF is the most appropriate place to give back as well as extend my technical skills. Furthermore, I believe that the multidisciplinary nature

t the multidisciplinary nature of INCF, which interlaces AI, neuroscience, and open -source, offers a deeply enri ched experience beyond normal academic pursuits. The adaptive nature of INCF's ethos as well as its creative spirit not only attract me, but actually inspire me to test the boundaries of

e me to test the boundaries of what can be done. I am eager to bring my experience, passion, as well as new concepts to the community, enhancing projects with the potential to revolutionize our understanding of the brain as well as the face of technology in science." The modern reality of music educ

e modern reality of music education can struggle to provide adaptive, personalized learning experiences. Static curricula and outdated teaching methods are unable to meet students' varying paces and learning styles, contributing to disengagement as well as disappointing results. HarmonyHub solves th

results. HarmonyHub solves this issue by combining generative AI with a modular, web -based system on top of Angular and Ionic. Not only can such a system be used to generate dynamic, personalized music exercises, but it also can improve ov erall learning by means of a code -free, user -centric int

code -free, user -centric interface. By revolutionizing the provision of music education, HarmonyHub seeks to empower educators with innovative tools that provide individual needs -based adaptation as well as improved educational performance. HarmonyHub: Using Generative AI for Adaptive Learning in

ve AI for Adaptive Learning in Music Abstract a. Project Motivation Music education has long grappled with how to deliver personalized, adaptive learning experiences that meet the individual needs of every learner. C onventional methods default to a one-dimensional approach with a standard curriculu

oach with a standard curriculum applied to every learner, which can result in disengagement as well as stunted growth. HarmonyHub solves the problem by combining generative AI with adaptive, personalized music exercises that develop dynamically as the student progresses. b. Key Enhancement HarmonyHu

. b. Key Enhancement HarmonyHub offers a revolutionary solution through a modular web -based platform based on Angular and Ionic with state -of-the-art generative AI. The project's central stren gth is a dynamic AI module that generates personalized music practice materials automatically, enabling t

ials automatically, enabling teachers to simply personalize content via a code -free environment. The platform also has a dynamic theming system that streamlines UIUX and makes the learning environment engaging as well as accessible. c. Expected Impact Through the incorporation of adaptive learning

poration of adaptive learning and generative AI, HarmonyHub promises to greatly enhance student engagement and achievement. Teachers will be equipped to provide persona lized instruction, while students enjoy practice through exercises calibrated to their own pace and style of learning. These change

tyle of learning. These changes ultimately are not just enhancing the quality of music education, they are establishing a new benchmark for adaptive learni ng technologies in creative, non -traditional topics. How do I plan to achieve: Milestones My approach include:  Adaptive AI Module: A standalon

daptive AI Module: A standalone microservice (built using technologies like Python or Node.js) will use generative AI frameworks such as OpenAI GPT or Hugging Face to automatically generate personalized exercises. These exercises will be tailored to each students profile, skill level, and learning j

e, skill level, and learning journey. The module will offer RESTful API endpoints to allow smooth integration with the front -end.  User Interface  Experience: The front -end will be created with Ionic and Angular to offer a seamless hybrid experience across web and mobile platforms. A no -code inte

ile platforms. A no -code interface will empower educators to easily customize and publish exercises. Additionally, d ynamic theming  handled with SCSS and Angular services will enhance both usability and accessibility.  Modular, Scalable Architecture: The system will be organized into clear, functi

e organized into clear, functional layer:  Presentation Layer: Uses AngularIonic components for UI rendering, theming, and user interactions.  Business Logic Layer: Angular services will manage application state, user preferences, and coordinate with the Adaptive AI Module.  Adaptive AI Module: This

ule.  Adaptive AI Module: This microservice wil l focus exclusively on generating personalized content.  Data Layer: Stores user preferences locally, with optional backend storage for user profiles and exercise histories. A high -level diagram (Figure 1) will show how these components adaptive AI, f

hese components adaptive AI, front -end, and data storage are integrated. This design ensures clarity, maintainability, and scalability. Figure 1 Implementation Plan To ensure the project moves forward in an organized and efficient way, the work will be divided into distinct phases: Phase 1  Researc

tinct phases: Phase 1  Research and Planning:  Review the current HarmonyHub codebase and understand its modular structure.  Explore and evaluate different generative AI frameworks and audio processing libraries.  Finalize the design of the adaptive AI module, along wit h planned UI improvements and

h planned UI improvements and dynamic theming features. Phase 2  Development:  Adaptive AI Module: Build and deploy the AI module, including REST API endpoints to deliver personalized music exercises.  Front -End Enhancements: Use Ionic and Angular to crea te a no -code interface and incorporate dy

e interface and incorporate dynamic theming.  Set up Angular services to manage application state and facilitate communication between the front -end and the AI module. Phase 3  Integration  Testing:  Connect the adaptive AI module with the front -end, ensuring smooth and reliable data flow.  Conduc

nd reliable data flow.  Conduct thorough unit and integration testing to confirm that both the personalized exercise generation and the UI function as intended.  Collect early feedback fro m educators and users to guide refinements and improvements. Phase 4  Documentation  Final Integration:  Update

on  Final Integration:  Update all relevant documentation for both users and developers.  Complete the final system integration and perform comprehensive testing.  Prepare and release a beta version, including a demo that showcases the platforms new adaptive learning capabilities. Plan of Action: Ti

pabilities. Plan of Action: Timeline The project is expected to take about 350 hours over the course of 20 weeks. Weeks 1 4: Research and Planning  Get familiar with the HarmonyHub codebase and understand how its modular architecture is structured.  Explore different generative AI frameworks and aud

nerative AI frameworks and audio processing libraries to determine the best fit.  Finalize the design for the adaptive AI module, make UI improvem ents, and implement dynamic theming.  Define the technology stack and identify all key integration points. Weeks 5 10: Development Phase  Adaptive AI Mod

lopment Phase  Adaptive AI Module: Build and launch REST API endpoints that can generate custom music practice exercises using genera tive AI tools.  Front -End Development: Develop the core UI components using Ionic and Angular, and bring in dynamic theming with SCSS and Angular services.  Set up A

nd Angular services.  Set up Angular services to manage state and ensure smooth communication between the UI and the AI m odule. Weeks 11 16: Integration and Testing Phase  Connect the adaptive AI module with the front -end, ensuring a seamless and responsive user experience.  Run detailed unit and

ience.  Run detailed unit and integration tests on all components.  Use early feedback from testers to fine -tune real -time interactions and adaptive features.  Make any necessary changes based on whats discovered during testing. Weeks 17 20: Documentation and Final Integration  Finalize the full s

tegration  Finalize the full system integration and run comprehensive end -to-end testing.  Update and complete all documentation for both users and developers.  Package everything into the final deliverables, including a beta version and a demo showcasing the adaptiv e learning features. Gantt Char

learning features. Gantt Chart Open Source contributions and Projects Github Contribution 1. I recently worked on Issue 9, which focused on improving the user interface by adding a multi -color theme feature ( Figure 2 ). The goal was to let users choose between fun themes like Neon, Amber, and Bub

emes like Neon, Amber, and Bubblegum. Coming from a React and Next.js background, this was my first time really working with Angular, Ionic, and especially SCSS. I spent around three days learning the basics of these technologies. 2. After getting familiar with the codebase and investing about five

base and investing about five hours to understand how the components interacted, I successfully implemented the theme selection feature and submitted a pull request (21) (Figure 3 ). 3. The PR was reviewed by Mr. Mirko D'Andrea, who provided hel pful feedback. Ultimately, the PR was closed, as the t

y, the PR was closed, as the team decided that this feature isnt a top priority right now theyre currently focusing on more critical aspects of the project. (Figure 2) (Figure 3) That said, the experience helped me deepen my understanding of the codebase and become more engaged with the development

engaged with the development community. Community 1. Progress sharing: https:neurostars.orgtgsoc -2025 -project -2-harmonyhub -using - generative -ai-for-adaptive -learning -in-music -350h320765?uvishalk988 2. armonyhub -using - generativ e-ai-for-adaptive -learning -in-music -350h320766?uvishalk988 Projects I have created many projects which implements: 1. Protochain: Smart contract generation in Aptos, Polygon, Ethereum smart contract using users personalized prompt and user can deploy that smart contra

r can deploy that smart contract on their specific blockchain. 2. AI Presentation Builder: Somewhat achieved in building the personalized presenta tion builder for students and office workers 3. Mini: Similar to Bolt and v0. Studying the architecture of how they are creating and building website usi

ating and building website using users prompt 4. Image Processing on AWS cloud: Image processing using AWS 5. Voting application on K8s: deployed docker image and k8 from which user can vote in real time You can find more details and code samples on my GitHub repository, where I have documented the

, where I have documented the challenges I faced and the solutions I implemented. These projects reflect my dedication to creating user -friendly applications and my passion for innovative, real -time collaborative tools. Expectations from Mentor To make sure I stay aligned with the project goals an

gned with the project goals and receive timely guidance, I plan to have regular check -ins with my mentors, Alberto Acquilino, Mirko dAndrea and Keerthi Reddy Kambham. My approach is to schedule weekly meetings, which can be held via video calls or chat, depending on everyone's availability. These s

eryone's availability. These sessions will serve as a space to share updates, talk through any roadblocks, and get feedback or direction on upcoming tasks. Ahead of each meeting, Ill prepare a short progress report that outlines what Ive accomplished during the week, any issues I encountered, and wh

y issues I encountered, and what I plan to work on next. This will help keep the discussions focused and productive, and also make it easier for my mentors to track my progress and provide targeted support. Feedback plays a key role in how I approach development. After each meeting with my mentors o

each meeting with my mentors or interaction with the community, Ill take time to carefully go over the feedback I receive and make any necessary improvements to my work. Ill be following an iterative approach, meaning Ill continuously test, tweak, and refine my code based on suggestions and any issu

ed on suggestions and any issues that pop up al ong the way. This ongoing cycle of improvement will help ensure that the final outcome not only meets the projects goals but also goes above and beyond while staying closely aligned with what the community actually needs. By maintaining this consistent

By maintaining this consistent co mmunication loop, I hope to foster strong collaboration, stay accountable, and ensure that the project stays on course throughout the program. What are my other commitments? I can dedicate working time of approx 34 hrs per week, Constraints: 1. Im having 2 days of c

ints: 1. Im having 2 days of college Tuesday and Wednesday 2. Gym Schedule: 6pm to 10pm IST 3. End Semester exam in between April -May 4. Family Vacation break of 3 days (Most probably in july end) Here my weekly schedule:  Monday (Class - off ):  Work Time: 8 hrs  10am IST -6 PM IST   Tuesday (Clas

IST -6 PM IST   Tuesday (Class - On):  Work Time: 1 hrs  Anytime throughout my day   Wednesday (Class - On):  Work Time: 1hrs  Anytime Throughout my day   Thursday (Class - Off ):  Work Time: 8 - 9 hrs 10am IST - 7PM IST   Friday (Class - Off):  Work Time: 8 hrs  10am IST - 6PM IST   Saturday (Clas

IST - 6PM IST   Saturday (Class - Off ):  Work Time: 5hrs  12 pm IST - 5PM IST   Sunday (Class - Off ):  Work Time: 3hrs  Anytime throughout my day  What do I plan after the GSoC period is over? After the GSoC period wraps up, I plan to continue building and improving HarmonyHub by staying actively

armonyHub by staying actively involved with the user community and using their feedback to guide future development. One of my main goals is to expand the adaptive AI module so it can support even more complex and personalized music exercises, while also incorporating advanced audio processing featu

dvanced audio processing features. Alongside these technical upgrades, Ill be working on improving the platforms scalability and performance, making sure it can grow smoothly as more users adop t it. I also want to refine the user interface to keep it as intuitive and user -friendly as possible. Bey

ser -friendly as possible. Beyond just the code, Im committed to strengthening the ecosystem around HarmonyHub. This includes creating comprehensive documentation, offering trainin g resources, and doing community outreach to encourage both educators and developers to contribute and bring new ideas

ontribute and bring new ideas to the table. My long -term vision is to turn HarmonyHub into a sustainable, collaborative project that continues to push the boundaries o f adaptive music education well beyond the GSoC timeframe. To stay connected with the INCF (Harmony Hub) community, Ill remain acti

ub) community, Ill remain active in GitHub issues, mailing lists, and chat channels. These spaces are great for sharing progress, learning from others, an d exchanging ideas. I believe open and consistent communication is key, so Ill make it a point to regularly update my GitHub repositories and res

my GitHub repositories and respond quickly to any questions or suggestions from the community. As part of that community, Ive also had the chance to help fellow developers by guiding them through their issues something I plan to continue doing as the project grows. Who am I: About me 22 years old fi

am I: About me 22 years old final year student in CSE from Chandigarh University with an interest for using the latest technology for the creation of innovative projects. Currently, I am working on 'ProtoChain' with the use of Next.js, a go -big project that generates smart contracts according to th

mart contracts according to the input provided by the users, and I am looking into the integration of models by Gemini and Cohere in order to capitalize on AI functionality. Concurrently, I have developed a cloud -based serverless image processing application as a college assignment, wherein with su

ge assignment, wherein with success, I orchestrated the uploading, processing (resizing, converting grayscale, etc.), and saving of the images using AWS Lambda, S3, and API Gateway supplemented by a strong Python (PIL) and HTMLJavaScript fronte nd. My creativity came into the limelight when I won th

to the limelight when I won the Electrothon 7.0 hackathon march 2025, winning the Gemini track award for my smart contract generator. Concurrently working on these projects, I am in the process of learning the backend and fronte nd operations of sites such as bolt.new and the v0 website and learning

nd the v0 website and learning real -time tech such as socket.io. With hands -on experience with frontend tech and a foundation with cloud tech attested by my certifications in the same I am proficient in programming with C, Java, and Python, developing with React.js, JavaScript, and TypeScript, and

avaScript, and TypeScript, and working with databases and backend admin with MySQL, Prisma, and Drizzle ORM. My expertise extends further into DevOps and version control with the use of tools such as GitHub, Docker, Kubernetes, all of which serve as the foundation for my expert focus on web design a

y expert focus on web design and DevOps. The experience I possess: Places worked In addition to the experiences Ive shared, I actively participated in Hacktoberfest, where I contribute d to several organizations by enhancing their documentation and improving their codebases. This involvement allowed

ases. This involvement allowed me to collaborate with diverse teams and sharpen my coding skills. Currently, Im broadening my expertise by exploring AI -driven presentatio n builder applications and delving into Expo a framework that shares similarities with Ionic. These endeavors are part of my ong
e endeavors are part of my ongoing commitment to learning and applying modern technologies in real-world projects.
